item.title: Gnome
item.description: How to install a GNOME extension starting from the zip archive Get the extension’s uuid: $ unzip -c [zip-file] metadata.json | grep uuid | cut -d \" -f4 Create the destination directory: $ mkdir -p ~/.local/share/gnome-shell/extensions/[extension-uuid] Unzip the GNOME extension: $ unzip -q [zip-file] -d ~/.local/share/gnome-shell/extensions/[extension-uuid]/` Enable GNOME extension: $ gnome-extensions enable [extension-uuid] Apply Dark theme to Qt applications N.B.: this method is both valid for Gnome and Mate (tested on Endeavour OS).

item.title: Pandoc
item.description: Requirements Arch Install texlive-most: $ sudo pacman texlive-most Install pandoc: $ sudo pacman -S pandoc Fedora Install texlive-scheme-full: $ sudo dnf install texlive-scheme-full Install pandoc: $ sudo dnf install pandoc Commands Convert a markdown file into a PDF file: $ pandoc [markdown file] -s -o [PDF file]

item.title: Vim
item.description: Basic commands: i: insert mode Esc: document navigation mode u in navigation mode: undo CTRL + R: redo :q: exit :q!: exit without saving :wq: save and exit :w: save /[word to search]: search a word :[line number]: go to the specified line Save custom settings permanently Windows Append the instructions (e.g., :set number) to C:\Users\<username>\_vimrc Linux Append the instructions (e.g., :set number) to ~/.vimrc Line numeration :set number: display line numbers :set nonumber: hide line numbers Spell Check: Append the following line to ~/.
